reviewText:
Early Access Review

I wasn't sure what to expect when I first fired it up, but I think it shows promise. It reminds me of This War is mine, sort of, in that you have to manage a group of survivors, keep them fed, stocked up on ammo, send scouts, and move out to expand territory.

I have only have a play around with it, but here is the first 20 minutes of gameplay for those that would find this helpful.

https://youtu.be/JPq69zsZrtg
voteText: 24 of 35 people (69%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EARLY ACCESS REVIEW.
I like it I have played 6 Hours so far and can already see that this game is going to be a good game, yes it comes with glitches and bugs but after only a few days on release you can see its potential, there are some things that could do with being changed such as Inventory management, skill levelling for the survivors themselves, and other tweaks but this game in time will be a good one, it might be worth waiting for a few updates but at the price that it is I believe its worth the coin.
to those that have played no time at all in this game and wrote bad reviews clearly did not give the game time to get going I can only say that these people should stop buying games that are EA as they just won’t get it.
TO THE DEV:
Ignore some of your bad reviews and don’t let them discourage you they have not put the hours in, have no idea what they are talking about and are quite simply complete and utter Muppets.
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME IF YOUR EXPECTING A FINISHED OR COMPLETE PRODUCT BUT I AM IN THE BELEIF THAT THIS GAME WILL AFTER SOME UPDATES ONLY GET BETTER
voteText: 13 of 17 people (76%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is still in very Early Access, so I wasn't expecting much -- but damn the game gets addictive!!!

There's still a lot of work needed, and various balancing, UI, content, and some minor bug corrections needed, but the game seems to be going in a very nice direction, and does feel kinda fresh... and did I mention damn the game gets addictive!!!"

Give the low Early Access pricing
date: I would say it's quite worth the money already... and hell
recommended: there have already been a couple of nice updates since I first bought it. I definitely recommend giving it a shot.\n\nAnd... Damn the game gets addictive!!!"

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSo the game is in earlllllly stages, but it shows promise. I think it's going to be a lot of fun when it is completely finished. Right now, I can only recommend it to anyone who is okay with playing games while in their testing" stage - you'll encounter bugs and crashes

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you like Zafehouse Diaries, you may enjoy Envy the Dead as the game offers the same basic game mechanics.

Go from one spot to another while looting, fighting zombies and doing your best to survive.

It is in early access but the game looks quite promising at this stage supported by decent graphics and simple interfaces to use and figuring out wihtout going through a big tutorial.

I think the zombie hord combat section could be improved by allowing level scrolling, team ordering and possibly a retreat option... Hopefully this section will be improved in future version.

Worth trying if you are into zombie survival strategy game and at least worth to follow how the game development progresses.
Early Access Review\n\nHas SOO much potienial, cant wait to see it evolve into a full game!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is looking good, I do hope they are going to continue working on it!
The graphics aren't the best, and there are some bugs and such.
The game is worth it, but I recommend buying at a discount. But then again, if you do buy it at full price the developers have more to use on the improvements!
But it is recommended to buy it, and if you enjoy zombie games, this is a must!
